text.author: MTSAMPLES.COM
text.title: Followup Screw Fixation
text.summary: A 59-year-old man's followup 4 months post percutaneous screw fixation of a right Schatzker IV tibial plateau fracture and 2nd-5th metatarsal head fractures shows good pain control and incision and fracture healing, but decreased foot sensation (L4-L5 distribution bilaterally) and bridging callus, recommending physical therapy and neurologist/surgeon if paresthesias worsen.

p.s: Followup NN followup 4 CD 4 months NNS month status NN status post IN post percutaneous JJ percutaneous screw NN screw fixation NN fixation of IN of a DT a right JJ right Schatzker NP Schatzker IV NP IV tibial JJ tibial plateau NN plateau fracture NN fracture and CC and second JJ second through IN through fifth JJ fifth metatarsal JJ metatarsal head NN head fractures NNS fracture treated VVN treat nonoperatively RB nonoperatively . SENT .
